title: Japan’s Kishida Faces By-Election Tests as Support Slides
description: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party faces two special elections on Sunday, where any loss would be a fresh setback for Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, whose public support has sagged to its lowest since he took office.

title: Saudi Arabia Mulls Buying 54 Dassault Fighter Jets, Tribune Says
description: Saudi Arabia is considering the purchase of 54 Rafale fighter jets from French manufacturer Dassault Aviation SA, according to a report in La Tribune.

title: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt Won’t Quit Parliament Before Election
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt has no plans to step down before the next election, his spokesman said after the Observer newspaper reported that Hunt would resign from Parliament before the vote.

title: NATO Admiral Says Growing China-Russia Ties Raise Risk in Arctic
description: NATO is increasingly concerned about China’s shipping on Russia’s Northern Sea route, and the possibility that its commercial and scientific interests could be a precursor to a Chinese military presence in the Arctic, the alliance’s senior military officer said.

title: Egypt Is Courted on All Sides as Pivotal to Gaza Refugees’ Fate
description: The war between Israel and Hamas has turned the spotlight on Egypt’s role as a regional powerbroker, potentially winning it Western support as it tries to escape a grinding economic crisis.

title: Mexico Joins Forces With China to Curb Illegal Chemicals Trade
description: Mexican diplomats and law enforcement officials visited China last week for talks over how to curb the smuggling of chemicals used by cartels to make illegal drugs.

title: Top Republicans Emmer, Johnson Join Wide-Open Speakership Race
description: Representatives Tom Emmer and Mike Johnson entered the race for US House speaker, throwing two high-ranking Republicans into the mix of a crowded pool of candidates.

title: Web Summit CEO Cosgrave Quits After Israel Controversy
description: Paddy Cosgrave has stepped down from his role as chief executive officer of Web Summit after his remarks following attacks on Israel earlier this month caused high-profile attendees, including Alphabet Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc., to pull out of the show.

title: Egypt’s Gaza Summit Starts With Arab Call for Two-State Solution
description: Arab leaders dubbed Israel’s retaliatory strikes on Gaza “collective punishment” and stressed that a stable and secure outcome to the Israel-Palestinian conflict must be built on a two-state solution.

title: IMF Economist Says France Will Struggle to Reach Deficit Target
description: France will have trouble meeting a target to narrow its deficit to 2.7% in 2027, according to the chief economist of the International Monetary Fund.

title: Sunak Mulls Stamp Duty, Top Earner Tax Cuts to Win Back Voters
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is considering stamp duty reductions and other tax cuts for top earners after the Conservative Party’s latest by-election defeats, according to newspaper reports.

title: Venezuelan Opposition Choose Candidate to Take on Maduro: What to Watch
description: Venezuela’s opposition will choose on Sunday the candidate who’ll try to end a quarter century of socialist rule in 2024 elections.

title: Marcos Says Saudi, Gulf Nations Interested in Philippine Fund
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said Saudi Arabia and other Gulf nations had expressed interest in the Southeast Asian nation’s sovereign wealth fund.

title: Aid Crosses Into Gaza for First Time Since War Began, TV Reports
description: Trucks carrying aid for Gaza began crossing the Rafah border point with Egypt for the first time since the Israel-Hamas war began, footage aired by Egyptian TV channel Extra News showed Saturday.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russia Pushes Near Avdiivka Despite Heavy Losses
description: Almost 20 months into an invasion conceived as a “special military operation” lasting days or weeks, the Kremlin is convinced that developments — especially the deepening conflict between Israel and Hamas that’s distracting Kyiv’s allies — are moving in Vladimir Putin’s favor. Moscow is more confident it can hold onto territories in southern and eastern Ukraine seized in 2022, said people with knowledge of the situation.

title: Israel Latest: Leaders to Meet in Cairo After Hostage Release
description: Leaders and senior officials from the Middle East and Europe will meet in Cairo on Saturday in a bid to ensure aid supplies get into Gaza and prevent the Israel-Hamas war becoming a wider conflict.

title: First Woman to Lead Germany’s Biggest Union Takes Aim at Tesla
description: The incoming first female head of Germany’s most powerful labor union IG Metall is warning Elon Musk about efforts to avoid unionization at his Tesla Inc. factory near Berlin.

title: Labour’s Israel-Gaza Tensions Mar Week of Starmer Triumphs
description: There was a celebratory mood inside the Labour Party’s London headquarters on Friday, buoyed by two huge by-election victories that suggest Keir Starmer is on course to be the UK’s next prime minister.

title: Sunak’s AI Guest List Risks Falling Short as Leaders Hold Back
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was hoping his AI summit next month would bring heads of the most powerful nations face-to-face with executives to guard against the technology’s “catastrophic” potential. With less than two weeks to go, the guest list is thin on world leaders.

title: Videos Show Rocket From Gaza May Have Hit Hospital, AP Says
description: Shortly before 7 p.m. Tuesday, a volley of rockets lit up the darkened sky over Gaza. Videos analyzed by The Associated Press show one veering off course, breaking up in the air before crashing to the ground.

title: Putin Plays for Time in Ukraine With US, EU Focused on Mideast
description: Vladimir Putin is increasingly confident Russia’s military can outlast Ukraine as a second winter of war approaches with Kyiv’s US and European allies distracted by the deepening conflict between Israel and Hamas.

title: Taiwan Names TSMC Founder Morris Chang as APEC Summit Envoy
description: Taiwan has appointed Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. founder Morris Chang as its special envoy to next month’s Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit, where the presidents of the US and China are likely to meet for the first time in almost a year.

title: US Official Says Export Curbs Will Impede China’s Chip Progress
description: The US-led restrictions over advanced chipmaking equipment for Chinese firms will ultimately deter China’s efforts to develop an indigenous semiconductor industry, according to a senior American official responsible for enforcing export controls.

title: Japan’s Kishida Orders Temporary Tax Cuts Ahead of By-Elections
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida instructed his ruling party executives to consider introducing temporary tax cuts, days before two special elections in which his ruling party faces tough opposition to hold onto its seats.

title: Treasury Official’s Mideast Mission Targets Hamas Financial Ties
description: A top Treasury Department official is heading to Saudi Arabia and Qatar next week to intensify US efforts to cut off financial lifelines to Hamas and discuss humanitarian aid for the Gaza Strip.

title: US and Israel Weigh a Future for the Gaza Strip Without Hamas
description: U.S. and Israeli officials looking to the future of the Gaza Strip after dislodging Hamas have begun discussing possibilities, including potentially installing an interim government backed by the United Nations and with the involvement of Arab governments, people familiar with US government deliberations said.

title: Amazon Joins Web Summit Defection Following Israel Comments
description: Amazon.com Inc. joined companies and investors bowing out of the upcoming Web Summit technology conference in Europe after the event’s leader made controversial comments about Israel.

title: Ex-Prime Minister Sharif to Return to Pakistan After Four Years
description: Four years ago Nawaz Sharif left Pakistan, dodging a jail sentence on health grounds as ties with the powerful military soured. Now, the three-time former premier is heading back, prompting speculation his allies brokered a deal with the generals for his return to politics and he may become prime minister again.
